divs: sighting detailssighting report: on friday april 8, 2005 i was scheduled to meet someone in the parking lot of schering-plough pharmaceuticals, morris avenue in union, new jersey. i had arrived about 45 minutes early so i sat in my truck and listened to a radio talk show. it was about 1:30-1:45pm and it was a beautiful mostly clear day with some very high lines of white clouds on a mostly blue sky. there was some breeze, but i don t recall there being much. i was facing an unobstructed view of the north easterly sky over the top of the schering facility and looking at nothing in particular as i listened to the radio, when i noticed a dark "dot" moving\flying in a slightly undulating manner in a very open section of the sky. it was moving from almost straight ahead of me towards my left. because it wasn t flying in a straight line with a purpose as a plane or jet would, i thought at first it was a bird flying up pretty high. i kept thinking that at any second i would see wings or see it do something bird-like. i could not estimate how high it was since i had no real point of reference. although there were plenty of planes and jets going by at various altitudes, i can only say that this was a dark dot by comparison; it appeared to be round and about the size of the period at the end of this sentence. anyway, after observing its gently arcing flight, i noted that it suddenly stopped and was standing perfectly still in the sky. i think this was due north. i kept watching it, now thinking that since i can t see wings and a bird wouldn t hover so long that maybe it might be a helicopter. it must have remained perfectly stationary for at least 45 seconds to a minute. i kept looking and looking at it; i took off my sunglasses, put them back on, looked through my open side window, through the windshield and then back through the open window again, but couldn t see anything else except an unmoving dark dot. meanwhile, planes and jets continued to move about in the sky although none appeared to pass close by the dot. at no time did i ever see any shine or glint of sunlight reflecting back from this object. anyway, it finally started to move again and now it is moving back more or less in the direction it came from, from my left to the right but it appears to be rising up "higher" before it again stops. i continue to stare at it, and now it appears that small "pieces" are "shooting" from the top of the dot (the dot now appears very slightly elongated but not much larger). when the "pieces" come "arcing" out of it i can t see them anymore, they disappear and the sky looks a bit fuzzy around the dot. at the time i am thinking to myself that maybe it looks fuzzy just because i am staring at it so intently. after sitting stationary for what i am estimating to be about 10 to 15 seconds the dot moves in yet another direction (more to the right, but "down" and more level now) and i am thinking it is also going "away" from me because it appears even smaller. again, it s flight is not a straight line like a plane or jet, it is more a gentle arcing motion. it moves quite a distance across the sky (from left to right but it s in front of me now rather than to my side) before i see it start to move "up" and very suddenly it is gone completely. i keep looking and looking in the same area thinking that the dot will reappear and i will see that it is a shiny plane, a helicopter or even a bird, dragonfly or bumblebee, but i do not see it again. the entire episode lasted for perhaps 5 minutes and i am still thinking there is a logical explanation as to what it might have been. by the way, i am 51 years old and while i am intrigued to imagine that there might be ufos from other worlds surveying us, i am not comfortable enough with what i saw to blab to my friends that i saw a ufo. i did tell a friend who says he has experienced some unusual sightings, and he suggested i report what i saw for you to investigate. i have not included my telephone number because my husband pooh-poohs talk of such "sightings."
